intro: Balthasaria schliebenii var. intermedia, commonly known as the Schlieben's balthasaria, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features include a taproot system and a unique arrangement of leaves that aid in its survival in specific microhabitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
